If at first, the idea is not absurd, then there is no hope for it.
If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.
An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy of being called an idea at all.
Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen.
The way to get good ideas is to get lots of ideas and throw the bad ones away.
There is one thing stronger than all the armies in the world, and that is an idea whose time has come.
Ideas won't keep. Something must be done about them.
A new idea is delicate. It can be killed by a sneer or a yawn; it can be stabbed to death by a quip and worried to death by a frown on the right man's brow.
All achievements, all earned riches, have their beginning in an idea.
You can have brilliant ideas, but if you can't get them across, your ideas won't get you anywhere.
No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.
Nearly every man who develops an idea works it up to the point where it looks impossible, and then he gets discouraged. That's not the place to become discouraged.
It is the essence of genius to make use of the simplest ideas.
Nothing is more dangerous than an idea when it is the only one you have.
I had a monumental idea this morning, but I didn't like it.
An idea, like a ghost, must be spoken to a little before it will explain itself.
Everyone is in love with their own ideas.
Why is it I always get my best ideas while shaving?
One's mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions.

The air is full of ideas. They are knocking you in the head all the time. You only have to know what you want, then forget it, and go about your business. Suddenly, the idea will come through. It was there all the time.
Capital isn't that important in business. Experience isn't that important. You can get both of these things. What is important is ideas.
A mediocre idea that generates enthusiasm will go further than a great idea that inspires no one.
We often refuse to accept an idea merely because the tone of voice in which it has been expressed is unsympathetic to us.

If you want to kill any idea in the world, get a committee working on it.
Right now it's only a notion, but I think I can get the money to make it into a concept, and later turn it into an idea.

Just because you're a musician doesn't mean all your ideas are about music. So every once in a while I get an idea about plumbing, I get an idea about city government, and they come the way they come.
I begin with an idea and then it becomes something else.
New ideas pass through three periods: 1) It can't be done; 2) It probably can be done, but it's not worth doing; 3) I knew it was a good idea all along!
Almost all really new ideas have a certain aspect of foolishness when they are just produced.
Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up because they're looking for ideas.

You do things when the opportunities come along. I've had periods in my life when I've had a bundle of ideas come along, and I've had long dry spells. If I get an idea next week, I'll do something. If not, I won't do a damn thing.
If I have a thousand ideas and only one turns out to be good, I am satisfied.

Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life. Think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success. That is way great spiritual giants are produced.
Money never starts an idea; it is the idea that starts the money.
No idea is so outlandish that it should not be considered.
If you are possessed by an idea, you find it expressed everywhere, you even smell it.
The ability to express an idea is well nigh as important as the idea itself.
You can kill a man, but you can't kill an idea.

The man with a new idea is a crank - until the idea succeeds.
To turn really interesting ideas and fledgling technologies into a company that can continue to innovate for years, requires a lot of discipline.
An idea is salvation by imagination.
I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.
The great accomplishments of man have resulted from the transmission of ideas of enthusiasm.

Our best ideas come from clerks and stockboys.
Daring ideas are like chessmen moved forward: they may be beaten, but they may start a winning game.
